content:
_FieldInfo Interface

In this Article

Exposes the public members of the FieldInfo class to unmanaged code.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.CLSCompliant(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("8A7C1442-A9FB-366B-80D8-4939FFA6DBE0")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibImportClass(typeof(System.Reflection.FieldInfo))]
public interface _FieldInfo

Remarks

This interface is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

This interface preserves the vtable order of the System.Reflection.FieldInfo class members that can be accessed by unmanaged COM objects.

Properties summary

Attributes

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.Attributes* property.
DeclaringType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.DeclaringType* property.
FieldHandle

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.FieldHandle* property.
FieldType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.FieldType* property.
IsAssembly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsAssembly* property.
IsFamily

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamily* property.
IsFamilyAndAssembly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamilyAndAssembly* property.
IsFamilyOrAssembly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamilyOrAssembly* property.
IsInitOnly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsInitOnly* property.
IsLiteral

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsLiteral* property.
IsNotSerialized

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsNotSerialized* property.
IsPinvokeImpl

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPinvokeImpl* property.
IsPrivate

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPrivate* property.
IsPublic

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPublic* property.
IsSpecialName

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsSpecialName* property.
IsStatic

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsStatic* property.
MemberType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.MemberType* property.
Name

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.Name* property.
ReflectedType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.ReflectedType* property.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.Equals* method.
GetCustomAttributes(Boolean)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes* method.
GetCustomAttributes(Type,Boolean)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes* method.
GetHashCode()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetHashCode* method.
GetIDsOfNames(Guid,IntPtr,UInt32,UInt32,IntPtr)

Maps a set of names to a corresponding set of dispatch identifiers.
GetType()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetType* method.
GetTypeInfo(UInt32,UInt32,IntPtr)

Retrieves the type information for an object, which can then be used to get the type information for an interface.
GetTypeInfoCount(UInt32)

Retrieves the number of type information interfaces that an object provides (either 0 or 1).
GetValue(Object)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.GetValue* method.
GetValueDirect(TypedReference)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.GetValueDirect* method.
Invoke(UInt32,Guid,UInt32,Int16,IntPtr,IntPtr,IntPtr,IntPtr)

Provides access to properties and methods exposed by an object.
IsDefined(Type,Boolean)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.IsDefined* method.
SetValue(Object,Object)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.SetValue* method.
SetValue(Object,Object,BindingFlags,Binder,CultureInfo)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.PropertyInfo.SetValue* method.
SetValueDirect(TypedReference,Object)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.SetValueDirect* method.
ToString()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.ToString* method.

Properties

  • Attributes

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.Attributes* property.

    public System.Reflection.FieldAttributes Attributes { get; }

    Property Value

    • FieldAttributes

      The FieldAttributes for this field.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The Attributes property gets the attributes associated with this field.

  • DeclaringType

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.DeclaringType* property.

    public Type DeclaringType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The Type object for the class that declares this member.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The DeclaringType property gets the class that declares this member.

  • FieldHandle

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.FieldHandle* property.

    public RuntimeFieldHandle FieldHandle { get; }

    Property Value

    • RuntimeFieldHandle

      A handle to the internal metadata representation of a field.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The FieldHandle property gets a RuntimeFieldHandle, which is a handle to the internal metadata representation of a field.

  • FieldType

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.FieldType* property.

    public Type FieldType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The type of this field object.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The FieldType property gets the type of this field object.

  • IsAssembly

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsAssembly* property.

    public bool IsAssembly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the Assembly attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsAssembly property gets a value indicating whether this field has Assembly level visibility.

  • IsFamily

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamily* property.

    public bool IsFamily { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the Family attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsFamily property gets a value indicating whether this field has Family level visibility.

  • IsFamilyAndAssembly

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamilyAndAssembly* property.

    public bool IsFamilyAndAssembly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the FamANDAssem attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsFamilyAndAssembly property gets a value indicating whether this field has FamilyAndAssembly level visibility.

  • IsFamilyOrAssembly

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsFamilyOrAssembly* property.

    public bool IsFamilyOrAssembly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the FamORAssem attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsFamilyOrAssembly property gets a value indicating whether this field has FamilyOrAssembly level visibility.

  • IsInitOnly

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsInitOnly* property.

    public bool IsInitOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the InitOnly attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsInitOnly property gets a value indicating whether the field can only be set in the body of the constructor.

  • IsLiteral

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsLiteral* property.

    public bool IsLiteral { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the Literal attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsLiteral property gets a value indicating whether the value is written at compile time and cannot be changed.

  • IsNotSerialized

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsNotSerialized* property.

    public bool IsNotSerialized { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field has the NotSerialized attribute set; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsNotSerialized property gets a value indicating whether this field has the NotSerialized attribute.

  • IsPinvokeImpl

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPinvokeImpl* property.

    public bool IsPinvokeImpl { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the PinvokeImpl attribute is set in FieldAttributes; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsPinvokeImpl property gets a value indicating whether the corresponding PinvokeImpl attribute is set in FieldAttributes.

  • IsPrivate

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPrivate* property.

    public bool IsPrivate { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the field is private; otherwise; false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsPrivate property gets a value indicating whether the field is private.

  • IsPublic

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsPublic* property.

    public bool IsPublic { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this field is public; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsPublic property gets a value indicating whether the field is public.

  • IsSpecialName

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsSpecialName* property.

    public bool IsSpecialName { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the SpecialName attribute is set in FieldAttributes; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsSpecialName property gets a value indicating whether the corresponding SpecialName attribute is set in the FieldAttributes enumerator.

  • IsStatic

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.IsStatic* property.

    public bool IsStatic { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this field is static; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsStatic property gets a value indicating whether the field is static.

  • MemberType

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.MemberType* property.

    public System.Reflection.MemberTypes MemberType { get; }

    Property Value

    • MemberTypes

      A MemberTypes value indicating that this member is a field.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The MemberType property gets a MemberTypes value indicating that this member is a field.

  • Name

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.Name* property.

    public string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String containing the name of this member.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The Name property gets the name of the current member.

  • ReflectedType

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.ReflectedType* property.

    public Type ReflectedType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The Type object through which this object was obtained.

    Remarks

    This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The ReflectedType property gets the class object that was used to obtain this instance of MemberInfo.

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.Equals* method.

    public bool Equals (object other);

    Parameters

    • other
      Object

      The Object to compare with the current Object.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified Object is equal to the current Object; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The Equals method determines whether the specified Object is equal to the current Object.

  • GetCustomAttributes(Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes* method.

    public object[] GetCustomAttributes (bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • inherit
      Boolean

      Specifies whether to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes.

    Returns

    • Object[]

      An array that contains all the custom attributes, or an array with zero elements if no attributes are defined.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetCustomAttributes method returns an array containing all the custom attributes.

  • GetCustomAttributes(Type,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes* method.

    public object[] GetCustomAttributes (Type attributeType, bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • attributeType
      Type

      The type of attribute to search for. Only attributes that are assignable to this type are returned.

    • inherit
      Boolean

      Specifies whether to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes.

    Returns

    • Object[]

      An array of custom attributes applied to this member, or an array with zero (0) elements if no attributes have been applied.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetCustomAttributes method returns an array of custom attributes identified by Type.

  • GetHashCode()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetHashCode* method.

    public int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      The hash code for the current instance.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetHashCode method serves as a hash function for a particular type. GetHashCode is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

  • GetIDsOfNames(Guid,IntPtr,UInt32,UInt32,IntPtr)

    Maps a set of names to a corresponding set of dispatch identifiers.

    public void GetIDsOfNames (ref Guid riid, IntPtr rgszNames, uint cNames, uint lcid, IntPtr rgDispId);

    Parameters

    • riid
      Guid

      Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.

    • rgszNames
      IntPtr

      Passed-in array of names to be mapped.

    • cNames
      UInt32

      Count of the names to be mapped.

    • lcid
      UInt32

      The locale context in which to interpret the names.

    • rgDispId
      IntPtr

      Caller-allocated array that receives the IDs corresponding to the names.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::GetIDsOfNames, see the MSDN Library.

  • GetType()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetType* method.

    public Type GetType ();

    Returns

    • Type

      A Type object.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetType method gets the type of the current instance.

  • GetTypeInfo(UInt32,UInt32,IntPtr)

    Retrieves the type information for an object, which can then be used to get the type information for an interface.

    public void GetTypeInfo (uint iTInfo, uint lcid, IntPtr ppTInfo);

    Parameters

    • iTInfo
      UInt32

      The type information to return.

    • lcid
      UInt32

      The locale identifier for the type information.

    • ppTInfo
      IntPtr

      Receives a pointer to the requested type information object.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::GetTypeInfo, see the MSDN Library.

  • GetTypeInfoCount(UInt32)

    Retrieves the number of type information interfaces that an object provides (either 0 or 1).

    public void GetTypeInfoCount (out uint pcTInfo);

    Parameters

    • pcTInfo
      UInt32

      Points to a location that receives the number of type information interfaces provided by the object.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::GetTypeInfoCount, see the MSDN Library.

  • GetValue(Object)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.GetValue* method.

    public object GetValue (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The object whose field value will be returned.

    Returns

    • Object

      An object containing the value of the field reflected by this instance.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetValue method returns the value of a field supported by a given object.

  • GetValueDirect(TypedReference)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.GetValueDirect* method.

    public object GetValueDirect (TypedReference obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      TypedReference

      A TypedReference structure that encapsulates a managed pointer to a location and a runtime representation of the type that might be stored at that location.

    Returns

    • Object

      An Object containing a field value.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The GetValueDirect method returns the value of a field supported by a given object.

  • Invoke(UInt32,Guid,UInt32,Int16,IntPtr,IntPtr,IntPtr,IntPtr)

    Provides access to properties and methods exposed by an object.

    public void Invoke (uint dispIdMember, ref Guid riid, uint lcid, short wFlags, IntPtr pDispParams, IntPtr pVarResult, IntPtr pExcepInfo, IntPtr puArgErr);

    Parameters

    • dispIdMember
      UInt32

      Identifies the member.

    • riid
      Guid

      Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.

    • lcid
      UInt32

      The locale context in which to interpret arguments.

    • wFlags
      Int16

      Flags describing the context of the call.

    • pDispParams
      IntPtr

      Pointer to a structure containing an array of arguments, an array of argument DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts for the number of elements in the arrays.

    • pVarResult
      IntPtr

      Pointer to the location where the result is to be stored.

    • pExcepInfo
      IntPtr

      Pointer to a structure that contains exception information.

    • puArgErr
      IntPtr

      The index of the first argument that has an error.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::Invoke, see the MSDN Library.

  • IsDefined(Type,Boolean)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.IsDefined* method.

    public bool IsDefined (Type attributeType, bool inherit);

    Parameters

    • attributeType
      Type

      The Type object to which the custom attributes are applied.

    • inherit
      Boolean

      Specifies whether to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if one or more instance of attributeType is applied to this member; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The IsDefined method indicates whether one or more instance of attributeType is applied to this member.

  • SetValue(Object,Object)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.SetValue* method.

    public void SetValue (object obj, object value);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The object whose field value will be set.

    • value
      Object

      The value to assign to the field.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The SetValue method sets the value of the field supported by the given object.

  • SetValue(Object,Object,BindingFlags,Binder,CultureInfo)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.PropertyInfo.SetValue* method.

    public void SetValue (object obj, object value, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The object whose field value will be set.

    • value
      Object

      The value to assign to the field.

    • invokeAttr
      BindingFlags

      A field of Binder that specifies the type of binding that is desired (for example, Binder.CreateInstance or Binder.ExactBinding).

    • binder
      Binder

      A set of properties that enables the binding, coercion of argument types, and invocation of members through reflection. If binder is null, then Binder.DefaultBinding is used.

    • culture
      CultureInfo

      The software preferences of a particular culture.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The SetValue method sets the value of the field supported by the given object.

  • SetValueDirect(TypedReference,Object)

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.FieldInfo.SetValueDirect* method.

    public void SetValueDirect (TypedReference obj, object value);

    Parameters

    • obj
      TypedReference

      The object whose field value will be set.

    • value
      Object

      The value to assign to the field.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.

    The SetValueDirect method sets the value of the field supported by the given object.

  • ToString()

    Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.ToString* method.

    public string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string that represents the current Object.

    Remarks

    This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code, and should not be called from managed code.
